body:
### Problem

Output does not match neovims display: indented text is fully not visible and last line has multiple pipes.

![neovim](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1359d81f-2481-4209-91a2-37340158abee)

![html](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ccb66724-8b03-45f1-b873-7a407ef93dca)

### Steps to reproduce

```sh
$ nvim --clean -u init_plain.lua test.py
```
```vim
:TOhtml
```
Save and open in webbrowser

init_plain.lua

```lua
local lazypath = vim.fn.stdpath("data") .. "/lazy/lazy.nvim"
if not (vim.uv or vim.loop).fs_stat(lazypath) then
  vim.fn.system({
    "git",
    "clone",
    "--filter=blob:none",
    "https://github.com/folke/lazy.nvim.git",
    "--branch=latest", -- latest stable release
    lazypath,
  })
end
vim.opt.rtp:prepend(lazypath)

require("lazy").setup({
  {
    "lukas-reineke/indent-blankline.nvim",
    main = "ibl",
    opts = {},
    config = function()
      require("ibl").setup()
    end,
  },
})
```


test.py

```py
class TestClass:

    C = None

    M = "TEST"
```

### Expected behavior

HTML which is the same as displayed in neovim.

### Neovim version (nvim -v)

v0.11.0-dev-226+g721551210

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

n/a

### Operating system/version

MS Win 11

### Terminal name/version

wezterm 20231030-074559-75909682

### $TERM environment variable

xterm-256color

### Installation

zip
title: TOhtml.lua is broken while using indent-blankline.nvim
